titleStmt.title: The first part of the contention betwixt the two famous houses of Yorke and Lancaster with the death of the good Duke Humphrey: and the banishment and death of the Duke of Suffolke, and the tragical end of the prowd Cardinall of Winchester, with the notable rebellion of Iacke Cade: and the Duke of Yorkes first clayme to the crowne.
King Henry VI. Part 2
titleStmt.author: Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Valentine Simmes for Thomas Millington, and are to be sold at his shop vnder S. Peters church in Cornewall,

notesStmt.note: A corrupt and shorter version, possibly a memorial reconstruction, of "Henry VI, part 2" by William Shakespeare, which first appeared in finished form in the First Folio.
Running title reads: The first part of the contention of the two famous houses, of Yorke and Lancaster.
Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
